description:
Additions and alterations in connection with use of the
building as 3 self-contained maisonettes, together with
associated car parking and landscaping.
As shown on drawing numbers: 6748/01 - 08 (incl.), 111A,
112B (as existing) 6748/405A, 406B, 407B, 408, 409, 411,
413B, 451B, 452B, 453B, 454A (as proposed)
Additional information includes photographs 6748/PS01 and 02
and Tree Condition survey and Arboricultural Impact
Assessment from Hal Appleyard dated 15/1/01 Ref: MRD 1123/ha
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - No meter boxes, flues, vents or pipes shall be fixed or installed on the [external face][street elevations] of the building.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least 5 years following the completion of the development hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. [In particular, details shall be submitted to the Council before works commence on site to demonstrate how the (specify tree/location) shall be protected during construction work: such details shall for instance include measures to protect the tree trunk, to prevent additional soil compaction around the root zone, and to reduce damage to the lower branches including any proposals for crown uplifting.]

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN61 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - By not later than the end of the planting season following
    the completion of the development hereby permitted, or any
    phase of the development, trees shall be planted on the land
    in such positions and of such size and species as may be
    agreed with the Council. Any trees removed, dying, being
    severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5
    years of planting shall be replaced by trees of a similar
    size and species to those originally required to be planted.

Condition : 6 - The new window at lower ground floor level on the eastern
    elevation adjacent to no. 32 Arkwright Road shall be obscure
    glazed and permanently retained as such.

Condition : 7 - The areas of flat roofs at first floor level shown on
    drawing no. 6748/453B shall not be used for sitting out.

Condition : 8 - All new windows shall be sliding sash windows to match
    existing in terms of method of opening, materials, joinery
    profile, appearance and finishes.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN15 + EN35 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area in accordance with the requirements of policy
    EN61 + EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN161 + EN35 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring
    premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1
    and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring
    premises in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1
    and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - You are requested to ensure that the owner(s) of the trees
    on which you intend to carry out the proposed work have
    given their consent before the work begins.

Condition : 18 - The Council's Streets Management Engineering Services should
    be consulted regarding the construction of the crossover on
    the public highway and any other work to, under, or over,
    the public highway, including vaults and thresholds. The
    Section dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town
    Hall, Argyle Street London WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444).

Condition : 19 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in
    strict compliance with the plans referred to in this
    permission. Any alteration to the approved scheme resulting
    either from the requirements of the Building Control
    Manager, or for any other cause, must not take place except
    with the written agreement of the Council as local planning
    authority.

Condition : 20 - The enclosed leaflet sets out the Council's guidelines for
    the protection of trees on development sites.

Condition : 21 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 22 - If a revision to the postal address becomes necessary as a
    result of this development, application under Part 2 of the
    London Building Acts (amendment) Act 1939 should be made to
    Records and Information Team, (Street Naming and Numbering)
    Environment Department, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street,
    London WC1H 8EQ (tel 020 7974 5613)

Condition : 23 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939
